PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_SpaceThermalLoadPHistory
PropertySetDef.Definition: The space thermal load IfcSpaceThermalLoadProperties defines actual measured thermal losses and gains occurring within a space or zone. The thermal load source attribute defines an enumeration of possible sources of the thermal load.

PropertyDef.Name: People
PropertyDef.Definition: Heat gains and losses from people.

PropertyDef.Name: EquipmentSensible
PropertyDef.Definition: Heat gains and losses from equipment.

PropertyDef.Name: AirExchangeRate
PropertyDef.Definition: Loads from the air exchange rate.

PropertyDef.Name: DryBulbTemperature
PropertyDef.Definition: Loads from the dry bulb temperature.

PropertyDef.Name: InfiltrationSensible
PropertyDef.Definition: Heat gains and losses from infiltration.

PropertyDef.Name: TotalSensibleLoad
PropertyDef.Definition: Total energy added or removed from air that affects its temperature. If a value is less than zero (negative), then the thermal load is lost from the space. If a value is greater than zero (positive), then the thermal load is a gain to the space.

PropertyDef.Name: TotalLatentLoad
PropertyDef.Definition: Total energy added or removed from air that affects its humidity or concentration of water vapor. If a value is less than zero (negative), then the thermal load is lost from the space. If a value is greater than zero (positive), then the thermal load is a gain to the space.

PropertyDef.Name: TotalRadiantLoad
PropertyDef.Definition: Total electromagnetic energy added or removed by emission or absorption. If a value is less than zero (negative), then the thermal load is lost from the space. If a value is greater than zero (positive), then the thermal load is a gain to the space.
